49c770d68db90383010fbc2d0c73c882 (00:07): re: http://www.json.org/json.js what is this syntax: (function(){ ... } )(); ?
eea926926eaceab1c94e5caff2f9242c (00:07): MikeD_, a bloody great way to create functions
eea926926eaceab1c94e5caff2f9242c (00:09): okay - let's say you wanted to create the dynamic function"var t=function(){alert(blah);}", where blah is a variable within the scope of teh function creator
eea926926eaceab1c94e5caff2f9242c (00:09): once t() is actually run, it does not know what blah is, as it has its own scope
eea926926eaceab1c94e5caff2f9242c (00:10): so, you must tell it what blah is, by passing it the correct value at the time of its creation
eea926926eaceab1c94e5caff2f9242c (00:10): var t=(function(blah){return function(){alert(blah);};})(blah);
eea926926eaceab1c94e5caff2f9242c (00:11): you might need to try it out a few times befor you are comfortable with it
49c770d68db90383010fbc2d0c73c882 (00:14): do you have a url to a more lengthy explanation?
189edbf28f3da1f5bf29efe53c42687b (00:14): actually you dont need to pass the argument, var t=(function(){return function(){alert(blah);};})(); should do it
49c770d68db90383010fbc2d0c73c882 (00:14): or know the name of this
189edbf28f3da1f5bf29efe53c42687b (00:14): `js closures @ MikeD_
c95720c193df40ce1618d1b00b040b42 (00:14): MikeD_, js closures: http://jibbering.com/faq/faq_notes/closures.html
189edbf28f3da1f5bf29efe53c42687b (00:15): and i might have been wrong about the no arguments :) gets confusing at times
49c770d68db90383010fbc2d0c73c882 (00:15): i've read about closures - (probably from the link you sent me) a few times and i still don't get it - i thought closures were bad things to be avoided
189edbf28f3da1f5bf29efe53c42687b (00:15): it's impossible to avoid them :) but it's good to know when they are created so you can limit memory usage among other things
189edbf28f3da1f5bf29efe53c42687b (00:16): a closure could potentially save memory too
189edbf28f3da1f5bf29efe53c42687b (00:16): but i gtg
